item.title: DSWD: P77.4B disbursed to families in second tranche of gov t aid disrtibution
item.description: Nearly 13 million families have already been provided with the cash assistance from the second tranche of the government's Social Amelioration Program, the Department of Social Welfare and Development said Wednesday.

item.title: Sotto expects Duterte's wrath to fall upon PhilHealth officials amid alleged irregularities
item.description: "Ang hinihintay ko ay magalit si PRRD sa kanila," Senate President Vicente Sotto III said.

item.title: DepEd central office closed from Aug. 19-23 for disinfection
item.description: The central office of the Department of Education (DepEd) in Pasig City will be closed starting Wednesday, August 19, 2020, to give way for a complex-wide disinfection and contact tracing activity.

item.title: Workers' quarters, household under localized lockdown in Taguig
item.description: A workers' quarters in one business establishment in Barangay Palingon-Tipas in Taguig City was placed under localized quarantine after some individuals got infected with COVID-19.

item.title: Quake-hit town in Masbate ran out of funds to aid victims --mayor
item.description: Masbate's Cataingan town has no funds to aid the victims of Tuesday's magnitude-6.6 earthquake because most of the budget was allocated to COVID-19 response, its mayor said on Wednesday.

item.title: UAE sees 'alarming' increase in coronavirus cases
item.description: An increase in the number of coronavirus cases over the past two weeks is "alarming" and may herald further increases in the near future, the United Arab Emirates' health minister said on Tuesday.

item.title: Quarantine passes needed when going from one town to another, entering malls in Cavite
item.description: Cavite Governor Jonvic Remulla on Wednesday announced that quarantine passes are still needed in the province when traveling from one town to another.

item.title: Drug suspect, arestado sa buy-bust sa QC; pulis na nakialam daw sa pag-aresto, hinuli rin
item.description: Arestado ang isa umanong tulak ng shabu sa isang buy-bust operation sa Quezon City, ayon sa ulat ni James Agustin sa Unang Balita nitong Miyerkoles.

item.title: Worldwide coronavirus cases reach 22.03 million, death toll at 774,989
item.description: More than 22.03 million people have been reported to be infected by the novel coronavirus globally and 774,989? have died, according to a Reuters tally.

item.title: 'Lucky' Chinese phone number fetches $300,000 at online auction
item.description: A "lucky" mobile phone number has sold for a whopping 2.25 million yuan ($300,000) after hundreds of people vied online for the right to use the apparently auspicious string of digits.

item.title: Magnitude 6.8 quake strikes southern Sumatra, Indonesia
item.description: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck off Indonesia's Sumatra island on Wednesday, with strong tremors felt in the area though seismology agencies said there was no risk of a tsunami and there were no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

item.title: Magnitude 5.2 aftershock hits Masbate
item.description: A 5.2-magnitude aftershock hit Cataingan in Masbate early Wednesday morning, PHIVOLCS reported.

item.title: Trump lashes out at Michelle Obama after convention takedown
item.description: Donald Trump lashed out Tuesday at former first lady Michelle Obama after she delivered a scathing takedown of his leadership at the Democratic National Convention, while two ex-presidents prepared their own arguments against the White House occupant.

item.title: UN expert urges states to ban evictions amid pandemic
item.description: A UN rights expert called Tuesday for governments to ban evictions until the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic ends, warning the number of people being expelled from their homes was rising globally.

item.title: Mali president and Prime Minister 'arrested' - mutiny leader
item.description: Mutineering soldiers in Mali on Tuesday detained President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita and Prime Minister Boubou Cisse, one of their leaders said.
